poem:
### The Rotunda's Chill

In the rotunda,  
where echoes of past  
and future twine,  
the frost-hued day  
turned history inwards—  
Trump, a figure,  
wrapped in breaths  
of cold rhetoric;  
the pillars hold secrets,  
stone-bound, unyielding,  
while the world  
watches shadows dance  
in the winter light—  
a silent inauguration.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Ironically, the venue was the Capitol building’s rotunda, one of the sites". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
